comment: Overall, pretty good. She's super sweet. I took her class online over the summer. It consisted of virtual labs and two group lab projects. Light work

Did group projects during an online class, literally had NO luck getting ahold of my group, so I got a couple low grades due to people not participating. This sucked, just work alone. Labs are virtual and super easy, tests and quizzes are easy as well. Lab Final is Proctored.

DO NOT TAKE HER!
Good person, but horrible professor. she's really smart that she doesn't know how to teach and she just thinks everyone knows the material. talks way too fast for you to take notes or catch up. test never have what she teaches in lectures or activities, whole class always fails. extra credit but picky about it. would not take again
Professor McKay is a nice person and this was an easy class. We had a group  project at the end of the semester. But she takes too long to grade assignments.

Professor McKay is kind, but her teaching style didn't work for me. The course relied mostly on worksheets and group work, with little direct instruction. There were many quizzes and a few tests, but minimal guidance on what to review. I wouldn't recommend it if you prefer structured teaching.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lots of homework--So many papers

comment: Professor Mckay was a great lab professor. The lab sheets and labs were not too difficult and she was not a hard grader. It was easy to keep an A in her class and she also provided about 4 assignments of extra credit. Will let you make up labs if you have an excuse.
Professor mckay is super easygoing and helps all her students during lab

Professor McKay is very sweet. She provides A LOT of extra credit opportunities to help you be successful in this course. Extra Credit is provided after the midterm grade is released (exam test corrections/extra credit homework). She also allows a full 8.5 x 11" cheat sheet on all 3 exams and the final. Requires a little extra reading/studying.

The other reviews do not make sense to me, Professor Mckay has been a great lab professor for me. She is nice and tries her best to make sure you understand the procedure and get a good grade on it. She is not a harsh grader, but she does take a bit to grade lab reports. She will also let you make up the lab with no penalty if you reach out to her

I don't understand the other ratings. Professor Mckay is a nice and good professor. She is relatively new to teaching, however is very nice on how her labs are. She breaks down concepts and goes around to students that have questions the entirety of lab. I still have not taken the final, but I can tell that she is just trying her best.

Flipped-style teaching, but just isn't good at teaching overall. 10 mins late to lab or lecture at least once a week. Group quizzes but they're always confusing. Tests are way more in depth than she teaches. If you want a good grade you have to do like 5 classes worth of homework and reading outside of lectures.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: I would not recommend this teacher because the work itself per week is not overly challenging, however, her tests have questions that are infinitely more specific than anything we have covered in class. In my experience, her work requires a very good understanding of some complex principles that she is not very skilled at explaining.

I didn't enjoy this session because of the way it was organized and the way the teacher conducted the lesson. She never taught us anything and was never perplexed by information herself, even though she expected us to know the answers to everything. There was no lockdown for the pre- or post-lab quizzes, but there was one throughout the final.

Didn't like this class bc of the teaching style & the organization of the class itself. She was expecting us to know the answers to everything but yet never taught us anything fr or confused about information herself. The pre/post lab quizzes were outside of class time with no lockdown but the final was lockdown in class. Does not grade fr.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: This class was very difficult due to the teaching style. Taught as if we already knew the material. Ignored questions and answered with another question instead of helping. 10+ pages on worksheets but not hard. Pre/post lab quiz before and after every lab no lock. Final in person w lock. questions are nothing like the quiz ones. Instru. never clear
